nodes.text: Minions of darkness... okay... Just so you know, you've been dead a long time. I don't know of too many minions running around right now. I guess the um... dastard... must have been stopped. You can probably rest easily now.

But what was the fate of that most scrofulous, fraudulent traitor and slayer of innocent cats? Didst he not receive the dire, dreadful, disastrous fate that he so owned by his treacherous ways? What hath became of Aquino?

nodes.message: Making sure Shawn reacts if he's read the Display Book. Feel free to change.

nodes.text: I'm pretty sure that Aquino was brought to justice. There's a book in the castle that says as much.
Was he drawn and quartered? Flayed alive? Where dost his body lie?
I'm not rightly sure...
Bah!
Wasn't Aquino the guy that tried to overthrow the Knights Luminar and let loose some old Dark One? I read something about it once.
Was Aquino drawn and quartered? Flayed alive? Where dost his body lie?
I don't really know...
Dost thou then think that I can willfully submit to the balm of oblivion knowing that there hath been no justice?
Sorry, I don't really know what happened to Aquino. It happened way before I was born.
Dost thou then think that I can willfully submit to the balm of oblivion knowing that there hath been no justice?
So what did happen to you? How did you two get stuck here?
Aquino lured us here with the promise of rare wine, a cup to pledge our friendship. Yet the cup he gaveth to me was tainted with the venom of an asp and the juice of the poppy.
As the poison seared my senses and stole away my volition, Chianti valiantly attacked the villain, only to have the damned malicious murderer kick poor Chianti and then seal us to our doom!
Your murder... murders... happened a long time ago. Why don't you just 'give up the ghost' and pass onward? What's the point of haunting a sealed room? - There's nobody to notice.

Didst we deserve to be so ignominiously slain in the guise of friendship? That fiend Aquino ruined a perfectly splendid vintage of Golden Wine to assassinate us! How so then can we unlock the chains that bind us to this loathsome deathbed when justice was not served?
We were once heroes! Now we are but lost, forgotten souls imprisoned in this anonymous murder site with no hope of redemption.
Oh, so you were once a hero... Who were you? I might have read about you in the history books.

Ah, dost thy texts of history indeed still speak of the deeds of the noble Sir Sheraton Burgundy, Knight Illuminari, and of his boon companion, Chianti? Has our heroism in the "Dark Sardonian War" been recorded for the ages?
Um.. er... I may have read something about that war a long time ago.

The Knights Luminar saved the entire world from the invasion of the Dark Ones, and this, THIS! is all the accolade that history hath bestowed upon us? That thou might have read something about a war once? Bah!
There's a painting of you and Chianti in the castle above. It's a really good likeness. It says that you were a hero, a vintner, and helped build this castle.
Verily, indeed, I supported the Knights Luminar when they first came to Sardonian shores. I helped the Knights drive the Dark Ones back to the abyss from whence they came.
That is to say, I deeded to the Knights Luminar this land and helped to create a thriving winery with which to support their noble causes.
In another part of the castle, there is a crypt with your name on it. It even mentioned Chianti. The epitaph said something about 'missing but not forgotten.'
Ah, if but my remains had been put in a place of honor instead of in this loathsome den of death, perhaps then I might rest peacefully!
I wish you could rest in peace...
There is no peace to be had from this foul prison of lies and murder in which I shall lie abandoned for all etenity.
May thy fate be kinder to thee than mine own.

nodes.name: A Ghost and His Cat
nodes.description: I learned the tragic tale of betrayal and murder from along time ago. I just wish there was some way to help these ghosts rest in peace.

nodes.text: <raarr!!>
Farewell.
Fare well? Fare well? Your words have no meaning to one who is very much dead at the moment. Fare well indeed.
I think you are trying to tell me something, but I don't understand. I don't speak ghost.
Arrrrooooouuuugh!
